job_description: <div>At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.<br><br>When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the mic and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 5,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.</div> <div style="text-align: center;"><strong>Data Scientist, People Analytics - Provo</strong></div> <div><strong>Why We Have This Role</strong></div> <div> </div> <div>The People Analytics team is growing as Qualtrics evolves. We use people data to inform and provide insights to decision-makers across the company. The analyst does this through the creation and dissemination of dashboards, reports, and other visual and statistical data products. The analyst explores opportunities for improving, calibrating, and automating analyses to the company. The analyst meets regularly with company stakeholders to understand the needs of senior leaders and the organization at large regarding issues affecting the Humans of Qualtrics. The analyst leverages all opportunities for learning and personal growth, as this makes the analyst a greater asset to the People Analytics team and the company at large.</div> <div> </div> <div><strong>How You’ll Find Success</strong></div> <ul> <li>Maintain strong and respectful relationships with those you interact with.</li> <li>Autonomously identify, set, and deliver against goals and timelines with little help and input from others.</li> <li>Take ownership and work independently on tasks and projects with little instruction.</li> <li>Proactively identify and resolve problems prior to escalation.</li> <li>Remain flexible and adaptable when project scope or plans change.</li> </ul> <div><strong>How You’ll Grow</strong></div> <ul> <li>You will have opportunities to learn how to use numerous people data tools, data systems, and analytical approaches to affect positive change in the lives of real people.</li> <li>You will be positioned to develop domain expertise in various types of people data, such as behavioral, operational, and experience data.</li> <li>You will have the ability to grow in data communication and storytelling skills that can help drive change across the organization.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Things You’ll Do</strong></div> <ul> <li>Design and automate people analytics processes to deliver rigorous insights at scale.</li> <li>Collect, clean, and integrate complex datasets.</li> <li>Evaluate people operations and programs for performance and effectiveness.</li> <li>Identify the moments that matter in the employee lifecycle and communicate strategic opportunities for growth to decision-makers.</li> <li>Analyze and disseminate insights in a form that is valued by decision-makers.</li> <li>Consult on analytics capabilities, insights, and opportunities with cross-functional stakeholders.</li> </ul> <div><strong>What We’re Looking For On Your Resume</strong></div> <div> </div> <div>Required:</div> <ul> <li>2-5 years of experience in people data, data analytics, or similar, with a preference for exposure to People Analytics</li> <li>Passion and curiosity for people data</li> <li>Ability to analyze, manipulate, or process large sets of data</li> <li>Ability to generate standard or custom reports summarizing people data insights for review by executives, managers, and other stakeholders</li> <li>Understanding of what drives human behavior and how to build highly effective teams</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Both creative & analytical problem-solving abilities</li> <li>Excellent planning, interpersonal, and time management skills</li> <li>Detail-orientation and an ability to prioritize and meet deadlines</li> <li>Ability to concurrently run multiple projects in a dynamic environment</li> <li>A general understanding of business objectives as they relate to HR functions</li> <li>The ability to effectively scope, solve, and scale wicked human problems</li> </ul> <div>Preferred:</div> <ul> <li>Advanced degree in statistics, data analytics, data science, industrial-organizational psychology, or equivalent.</li> <li>Advanced skills in data automation and demonstrated ability to conduct quantitative organizational research, streamline processes, and automate data dissemination to meet the needs of senior leaders and organizations.</li> <li>Experience with:</li> <li> <ul> <li>Microsoft Excel</li> <li>Google Analytics</li> <li>Tableau</li> <li>Snaplogic / SQL</li> <li>API / JSON</li> <li>Python</li> <li>MATLAB / R</li> <li>Qualtrics RC & EX products (Employee Engagement, 360, Lifecycle)</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <p><strong>What You Should Know About This Team</strong></p> <ul> <li> The People Analytics team at Qualtrics support the People team at large and the business with actionable, data driven insights surrounding our workforce.</li> <li>Team members on the People Analytics team are strategic advisors to leadership and are pivotal in enabling Qualtrics to improve engagement, retain employees, hire top talent, and uplift the employee experience overall.</li> <li>On the People Analytics team, we're committed to fostering teammates that are best-in-class data practitioners, empathetic advisors, and true team players. </li> </ul> <p><strong>Our Team's Favorite Perks and Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>100% of Performance based promotions - not politics or tenure.</li> <li>Catered lunch daily</li> <li>Culture - incredible work environment - you can wear jeans and bring your dog into the office, any time.</li> <li>Quarterly team activities, winter and summer parties, and lots of Qualtrics swag. </li> </ul> <p><em><strong>The Qualtrics Hybrid Work Model:</strong> Our hybrid work model is elegantly simple: we all gather in the office three days a week; Mondays and Thursdays, plus one day selected by your organizational leader. These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life. #onsite</em></p> <div> </div> <div><em>Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.</em></div> <div> </div> <div><em>Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws: </em></div> <div><em><a href="https://www.dol.gov/agencies/whd/posters/fmla">Family & Medical Leave Act</a>, <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/poster">Equal Opportunity Employment</a>, <a href="https://www.dol.gov/agencies/whd/posters/employee-polygraph-protection-act">Employee Polygraph Protection Act</a></em></div> <div> </div> <div><em>Qualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.</em></div> <div> </div> <div><em>Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.</em></div>

job_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt; at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Sales team is the driving factor behind revenue for Brex and every member of our team directly affects our bottom line. We focus on generating new opportunities, acquiring new customers, and building even stronger relationships with our current customers. Our winning culture recognizes big team wins and celebrates individual accomplishments. We ensure that top performers are recognized and have built a competitive environment to motivate and unify the team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you&#39;ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;As an UpMarket Account Executive, you will be part of a fast-paced upmarket sales team focused on sourcing net-new customers and generating revenue in our UpMarket segment (250-1000 employee range). This team is tasked with hunting exciting, growing, new clients for Brex and communicating the value of our industry-leading Financial Operating System (Corporate Credit Card, Expense Management, Travel, etc.).&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;If you thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, enjoy following proven processes, and love leading cross-functional teams to solve complex business challenges, this role is for you!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our SLC office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Deal Cycle Management:&lt;/strong&gt; Proactively identify and target potential customers while managing a high volume of medium-complexity sales cycles simultaneously, including prospecting, discovery, demo, and closing.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Pipeline Management:&lt;/strong&gt; Build and manage a robust sales pipeline with multiple channels (AE self-generated, SDR, Events Marketing, and Inbound), ensuring a steady flow of qualified leads and opportunities.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Value Selling:&lt;/strong&gt; Position yourself as a &lt;strong&gt;trusted business advisor&lt;/strong&gt;, effectively articulating Brex’s unique value proposition and solving customer pain points by focusing on business outcomes.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Process-Driven Selling:&lt;/strong&gt; Follow established sales processes, including leveraging Solution Consultants (SCs), pulling vendor files, and utilizing Mutual Action Plans (MAPs) to manage deals from start to implementation.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Cross-Functional Collaboration:&lt;/strong&gt; Lead cross-functional teams, including SCs, product, marketing, and implementation consultants, to ensure seamless deal execution and post-sale success. Be effective at driving alignment across internal partners.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Problem Solving:&lt;/strong&gt; Engage multiple stakeholders (e.g., Controller, Finance, IT, Procurement) on each opportunity, acting as a strategic partner and guiding them through complex decisions that deliver business growth and value.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;4+ years of B2B SaaS closing experience, preferably in a net-new logo acquisition environment and 1+ year of SDR/BDR experience&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity selling SaaS products/solutions with an ability to communicate business outcomes rather than relying solely on product features&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Process-oriented with experience following structured sales methodologies like MEDDICC/MEDPICC&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;An understanding of the value of strong, repeatable processes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proven success in entrepreneurial or scrappy environments, where you’ve had to build without relying on a big brand name&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to lead cross-functional teams, working closely with SCs and other internal stakeholders to drive deals to successful close&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Demonstrated ability to ramp quickly and close your first deal within 90 days&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience speaking the customer’s language rather than just focusing on product terminology&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity selling financial software (Expense Management, ERP, AP Automation, T&amp;amp;E, Accounting Software, etc.)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience managing medium-complexity sales cycles and leading strategic, consultative conversations with multiple stakeholders&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected OTE budgeted for this role is $165,000-205,000. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance.&amp;nbsp; Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Account Executive, Mid Market
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

Be effective at driving alignment across internal partners.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Problem Solving:&lt;/strong&gt; Engage multiple stakeholders (e.g., Controller, Finance, IT, Procurement) on each opportunity, acting as a strategic partner and guiding them through complex decisions that deliver business growth and value.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;4+ years of B2B SaaS closing experience, preferably in a net-new logo acquisition environment and 1+ year of SDR/BDR experience&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity selling SaaS products/solutions with an ability to communicate business outcomes rather than relying solely on product features&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Process-oriented with experience following structured sales methodologies like MEDDICC/MEDPICC&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;An understanding of the value of strong, repeatable processes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proven success in entrepreneurial or scrappy environments, where you’ve had to build without relying on a big brand name&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to lead cross-functional teams, working closely with SCs and other internal stakeholders to drive deals to successful close&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Demonstrated ability to ramp quickly and close your first deal within 90 days&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience speaking the customer’s language rather than just focusing on product terminology&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Experience Selling Financial Software: &lt;/strong&gt;Familiarity with financial technology solutions such as Expense Management, ERP systems, AP Automation, T&amp;amp;E platforms, and Accounting Software.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected OTE budgeted for this role is $208,000 - 230,000. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Account Executive, Mid Market

job_city: New York, New York, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Sales is the growth engine at Brex. We bring in new customers, expand existing relationships, and drive the company’s bottom line. With unlimited territories and uncapped opportunity, your ambition sets the ceiling. We win together, celebrate often, and reward performance. If you want to sell a category-defining product with real ownership, this is your team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex’s Accounting Channel is undergoing exponential growth, and we are looking for an Accounting Channel Partnerships Manager to accelerate the team. In this role, you&#39;ll be at the forefront of shaping and expanding our market presence, driving a critical engine of our company&#39;s success. We&#39;re on the hunt for a dynamic professional who excels at forging powerful alliances in the accounting and OCFO ecosystems. You’ll be responsible for building strong relationships, cultivating partnerships from the ground up, seamlessly integrating new partners into our ecosystem, and consistently hitting targets by transforming these connections into a steady stream of client referrals. If you have a history of exceeding expectations and a passion for creating mutually beneficial business relationships, this could be your chance to make a significant impact in a fast growing environment.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco or New York City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify, cultivate, and deepen relationships with high-potential accounting firms&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Craft and implement tailored go-to-market strategies for each partner&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Facilitate smooth onboarding of new partners and their teams&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Drive client referrals from our accounting partners to fuel revenue growth for Brex&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Serve as a product expert, articulating our value proposition to partners&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Be the connective tissue for partners to the Brex ecosystem&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Work cross-functionally across marketing, growth, direct sales, and product &amp;amp; engineering to drive co-marketing opportunities, onboard new clients, and inform our product roadmap&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Conduct regular performance reviews with key partners&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify and build relationships with multiple stakeholders within accounting firms&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Become an expert in Brex&#39;s product, features, and workflows and augment the voice of our Accounting Partners&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;3+ years in a closing sales role&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Demonstrated track record of consistently hitting targets and quotas&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to identify client needs through thoughtful questioning, active listening, and analysis; including but not limited to shared mutual referral goals, enablement sessions, and MBR/QBRs where necessary&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to deliver tailored, consultative solutions that align with partner’s needs and business goals&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to evaluate partnership performance, identify areas for optimization, and implement data-driven solutions&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong written and verbal communication skills, with excellent listening skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving startup environment&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proven ability to build trust and credibility with internal and external stakeholders.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Passion for community events and activations with partners&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience in collaborating with accounting firms&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Accounting background (CPA certification or relevant industry experience is a plus)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is USD $143,736 - $179,670. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Accounting Channel Partnerships Manager

job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Sales is the growth engine at Brex. We bring in new customers, expand existing relationships, and drive the company’s bottom line. With unlimited territories and uncapped opportunity, your ambition sets the ceiling. We win together, celebrate often, and reward performance. If you want to sell a category-defining product with real ownership, this is your team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex’s Accounting Channel is undergoing exponential growth, and we are looking for an Accounting Channel Partnerships Manager to accelerate the team. In this role, you&#39;ll be at the forefront of shaping and expanding our market presence, driving a critical engine of our company&#39;s success. We&#39;re on the hunt for a dynamic professional who excels at forging powerful alliances in the accounting and OCFO ecosystems. You’ll be responsible for building strong relationships, cultivating partnerships from the ground up, seamlessly integrating new partners into our ecosystem, and consistently hitting targets by transforming these connections into a steady stream of client referrals. If you have a history of exceeding expectations and a passion for creating mutually beneficial business relationships, this could be your chance to make a significant impact in a fast growing environment.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco or New York City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify, cultivate, and deepen relationships with high-potential accounting firms&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Craft and implement tailored go-to-market strategies for each partner&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Facilitate smooth onboarding of new partners and their teams&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Drive client referrals from our accounting partners to fuel revenue growth for Brex&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Serve as a product expert, articulating our value proposition to partners&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Be the connective tissue for partners to the Brex ecosystem&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Work cross-functionally across marketing, growth, direct sales, and product &amp;amp; engineering to drive co-marketing opportunities, onboard new clients, and inform our product roadmap&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Conduct regular performance reviews with key partners&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify and build relationships with multiple stakeholders within accounting firms&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Become an expert in Brex&#39;s product, features, and workflows and augment the voice of our Accounting Partners&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;3+ years in a closing sales role&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Demonstrated track record of consistently hitting targets and quotas&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to identify client needs through thoughtful questioning, active listening, and analysis; including but not limited to shared mutual referral goals, enablement sessions, and MBR/QBRs where necessary&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to deliver tailored, consultative solutions that align with partner’s needs and business goals&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to evaluate partnership performance, identify areas for optimization, and implement data-driven solutions&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong written and verbal communication skills, with excellent listening skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving startup environment&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proven ability to build trust and credibility with internal and external stakeholders.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Passion for community events and activations with partners&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience in collaborating with accounting firms&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Accounting background (CPA certification or relevant industry experience is a plus)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is USD $143,736 - $179,670. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Accounting Channel Partnerships Manager

job_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Accounting at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Accounting team at Brex ensures we produce accurate and timely financial results to stakeholders to guide the business forward.&amp;nbsp; We go beyond closing the books — we automate, iterate, and improve processes in close collaboration with partners across the business. The team also serves as power users and thought leaders for Brex&#39;s own products. We bring precision and curiosity to everything we build, combining deep ownership with a product mindset to help shape the future of finance.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do &lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Accounting Manager will play a key role in ensuring the integrity of our financial records and in developing scalable and sustainable processes as the business grows. In this role, you will be exposed to a variety of areas, primarily focusing on the accounting for Brex’s subsidiaries, which includes both regulated domestic and international entities. This work includes managing the accounting for our Bill Pay, Reimbursement and Repayment products, as well as intercompany transactions such as expense sharing and intercompany service revenue. Additionally, you will perform and implement key controls, and support the team through regulatory exams and audits. You will lead cross-functional work, partnering with our Banking Operations, System Engineers, Product and Compliance teams to complete these tasks and help drive the business forward. The Accounting Manager is expected to manage multiple priorities concurrently without compromising quality.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our Salt Lake City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ownership of reconciliations for customer bill pay, reimbursement and repayment activity&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ownership of accounting for and calculation of outstanding transmission liability&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Monitoring compliance with applicable financial regulations such as capital requirements&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Preparation of financial statements and regulatory reports associated with the various entities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Monthly calculation of intercompany expenses and revenues for various entities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Leading reviews and analysis of assigned account groupings for month end close&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Supporting month end close with preparation of various journal entries and reconciliations&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Assisting with annual audits and recurring exams of regulated entities and assisting with the audit of Brex Inc&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Establishing accounting processes for new products that impact Brex and its subsidiaries&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identifying and delivering process improvements via cross functional collaboration&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Creating sustainable, repeatable and scalable processes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify key controls in the areas of ownership mentioned above and ensure process documentation is complete and accurate&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;College graduate with a 4-year degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;4-6 years of public accounting or private industry experience&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and address difficult situations in a professional manner&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Innovative and able to provide “outside of the box” solutions&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Passion for having an owner’s mentality towards responsibilities and for career growth&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience implementing and improving business processes and systems&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong interpersonal skills and ability to manage deadlines effectively&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Effective verbal, listening, and written communication skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus Points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Relevant experience in accounting for broker dealers, international operations, and/or payment transmission activity&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge and experience using AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude and/or Google Gemini&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge and experience using NetSuite, Looker, Numeric and/or other data visualization or automation software&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Licensed CPA&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $110,000- $135,000. However, the starting base pay will depend on several factors, including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Accounting Manager, Legal Entity Controllership

title: Accounting Manager, Legal Entity Controllership

job_city: New York, New York, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Accounting at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Accounting team at Brex ensures we produce accurate and timely financial results to stakeholders to guide the business forward.&amp;nbsp; We go beyond closing the books — we automate, iterate, and improve processes in close collaboration with partners across the business. The team also serves as power users and thought leaders for Brex&#39;s own products. We bring precision and curiosity to everything we build, combining deep ownership with a product mindset to help shape the future of finance.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do &lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Accounting Manager will play a key role in ensuring the integrity of our financial records and in developing scalable and sustainable processes as the business grows. In this role, you will be exposed to a variety of areas, primarily focusing on the accounting for Brex’s subsidiaries, which includes both regulated domestic and international entities. This work includes managing the accounting for our Bill Pay, Reimbursement and Repayment products, as well as intercompany transactions such as expense sharing and intercompany service revenue. Additionally, you will perform and implement key controls, and support the team through regulatory exams and audits. You will lead cross-functional work, partnering with our Banking Operations, System Engineers, Product and Compliance teams to complete these tasks and help drive the business forward. The Accounting Manager is expected to manage multiple priorities concurrently without compromising quality.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our New York office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ownership of reconciliations for customer bill pay, reimbursement and repayment activity&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ownership of accounting for and calculation of outstanding transmission liability&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Monitoring compliance with applicable financial regulations such as capital requirements&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Preparation of financial statements and regulatory reports associated with the various entities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Monthly calculation of intercompany expenses and revenues for various entities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Leading reviews and analysis of assigned account groupings for month end close&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Supporting month end close with preparation of various journal entries and reconciliations&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Assisting with annual audits and recurring exams of regulated entities and assisting with the audit of Brex Inc&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Establishing accounting processes for new products that impact Brex and its subsidiaries&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identifying and delivering process improvements via cross functional collaboration&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Creating sustainable, repeatable and scalable processes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify key controls in the areas of ownership mentioned above and ensure process documentation is complete and accurate&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;College graduate with a 4-year degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;4-6 years of public accounting or private industry experience&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and address difficult situations in a professional manner&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Innovative and able to provide “outside of the box” solutions&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Passion for having an owner’s mentality towards responsibilities and for career growth&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience implementing and improving business processes and systems&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong interpersonal skills and ability to manage deadlines effectively&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Effective verbal, listening, and written communication skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus Points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Relevant experience in accounting for broker dealers, international operations, and/or payment transmission activity&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge and experience using AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude and/or Google Gemini&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge and experience using NetSuite, Looker, Numeric and/or other data visualization or automation software&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Licensed CPA&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $120,000- $155,000. However, the starting base pay will depend on several factors, including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Accounting Manager, Legal Entity Controllership
location: New York, New York, United States
locations: New York, New York, United States

job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Implementation at Brex&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Implementation transforms new customers into power users. We lead the onboarding experience for companies adopting Brex Empower, helping them shift from outdated processes to a modern, employee-first approach. It’s a role that blends customer empathy, project management, technical expertise, process design, and change management. We take personal ownership of our customers&#39; long-term success, and we set customers up thoroughly so they can be with ‘Brex for life’. As strategic advisors, we build trust, drive solutions with tenacity, deliver results fast, and work cross-functionally to make adoption seamless for customers.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;As an Associate Technical Consultant, you are responsible for guiding and supporting Brex’s customers with any integration-related implementations. You’ll be responsible for solving and providing best practices for customers&#39; challenges related to Brex Integrations. You are also responsible for ensuring customers are equipped with the necessary integration knowledge of the Brex Platform to reduce friction and optimize the customer experience.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our Seattle office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Become a knowledgeable resource for our customers, guiding them on ERP architecture and business process flows with the support of the team.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Support customers through their implementation journey by joining calls to address integration matters and assist with escalations for systems like NetSuite, QuickBooks, and Sage Intacct.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Serve as a crucial link between customers and our internal teams, channeling valuable product feedback to help us build a better experience.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Engage closely with the broader Integration team, actively participating in knowledge sharing and continuous learning to build your expertise.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Collaborate with our Engineering, Product, and Design (EPD) partners to support the seamless rollout of new and updated integrations, ensuring our customers are set up for success.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;1+ years of experience in a customer-facing role, working with accounting systems (Quickbooks Online, Netsuite, Xero)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Basic functional knowledge in the following areas: General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Billing, Expense Management, HRIS&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent communication skills, with an ability to explain the functionality and benefits of different integrations&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A collaborative spirit and experience working with a team to solve problems.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong organizational skills with an ability to manage assigned tasks and a keenness to drive projects forward.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A knack for problem-solving and the ability to recognize when to seek guidance from the team for more complex or technical issues.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $79,100 - $98,875.&amp;nbsp; However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Associate Technical Consultant
